type: Exchange of Falcon 20 Main Landing Gears (L/H & R/H)
short_summary: Replace Main Landing Gears on DA20 S/N 109
description: A detailed description of the requirement is provided in the Request for Proposal document.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
### Notification
## Exchange of Falcon 20 Main Landing Gears (L/H & R/H)

### Reference
* Solicitation Number: 24-58191
* Reference Number: cb-525-45786663

### Introduction
The National Research Council Canada (NRC) invites eligible suppliers to submit a proposal for the exchange of the main landing gears for the Falcon 20 aircraft. The NRC requires the overhaul of the main landing gear struts, which are currently installed on NRC aircraft DA20 S/N 109.

### Key Requirements
The winning supplier will be responsible for designing, manufacturing, and delivering new main landing gear assemblies that meet the specified requirements.

### Trade Agreements and Purchasing Guidelines
The Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement apply to this tender.

### Procurement Method
This tender is open to all eligible suppliers through a selective tendering process. Bidders must meet all the mandatory criterion described in the Request for Proposal.

### Important Information

* Deadline for Receipt of Proposals: 2024-12-03T14:00:00
* Evaluation Process: Bidders must meet all the mandatory criterion described in the Request for Proposal
* Contact Information:
	+ Name: Shawn Doyle
	+ Email: Shawn.Doyle@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca
	+ Phone: (343) 551-3688

### Notice
Please note that this request for proposal excludes any security requirements and customs duties. All prices must be submitted in Canadian currency, and applicable taxes are extra. Suppliers will be invited directly due to a non-responsive bid that closed on November 12th, 2024.

### Submission Guidelines
To be considered for this opportunity, proposals must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at least seven (7) calendar days prior to the bid closing date.
